title: Module 1: Capacity Planning - Measuring CPU Usage
note: Introduce capacity planning. Teach how to use `top`, `htop`, and `mpstat` to measure real-time and historical CPU load, identify bottlenecks, and understand user vs. system time.

title: Measuring Memory Usage
note: Teach how to interpret memory usage statistics using `free`, `vmstat`, and `/proc/meminfo`. Explain concepts like buffers, cache, and swap usage.

title: Measuring Disk I/O
note: Teach how to monitor disk I/O performance using `iostat` and `iotop` to identify which processes are causing disk contention and to measure throughput.

title: Measuring Network I/O
note: Teach how to monitor network throughput and connections using `ss`, `netstat`, and `iptraf-ng`.

title: Predicting Future Resource Needs
note: Introduce tools like `sar` for historical data collection. Explain how to use this data to forecast future resource needs and plan for system upgrades.

title: Module 2: The Linux Kernel - Kernel Components
note: Explain the structure of the Linux kernel source tree. Differentiate between the core kernel, modules, and firmware. Discuss kernel image types like `vmlinuz`.

title: Compiling the Kernel from Source
note: Walk through the process of downloading, configuring (`make menuconfig`), compiling (`make`), and installing a custom Linux kernel.

title: Kernel Modules
note: Teach how to manage kernel modules at runtime using `lsmod`, `modinfo`, `insmod`, and `modprobe`. Explain module dependencies and configuration via `/etc/modprobe.d/`.

title: Kernel Runtime Configuration with `sysctl`
note: Show how to view and modify kernel parameters at runtime using `sysctl` and the `/proc/sys/` filesystem. Explain how to make these changes persistent.

title: Module 3: System Startup - `initramfs`
note: Explain the role of the initial RAM filesystem (`initramfs`) in the boot process, particularly for loading necessary drivers before the root filesystem is mounted. Show how to inspect and rebuild an `initramfs` with `dracut` or `mkinitramfs`.

title: systemd: Service Management
note: Deep dive into managing services with `systemctl`. Cover `start`, `stop`, `restart`, `reload`, `enable`, `disable`, and `status`.

title: systemd: Understanding Unit Files
note: Explain the structure of systemd unit files. Show how to inspect existing unit files and how to create a simple custom service unit file in `/etc/systemd/system/`.

title: System Recovery
note: Teach how to boot into a rescue or emergency target to perform system recovery tasks. Cover mounting the root filesystem read-write and using `chroot`.

title: Module 4: Filesystems - `ext4` In-depth
note: Explore advanced features of the ext4 filesystem. Teach how to use `tune2fs` to adjust filesystem parameters and `debugfs` to inspect internal structures.

title: Filesystem Maintenance with `fsck`
note: Provide a detailed guide on using `fsck` to check and repair filesystem inconsistencies, explaining the different phases of the check.

title: SMART for Disk Health
note: Introduce the Self-Monitoring, Analysis, and Reporting Technology (SMART). Show how to use `smartctl` to view disk health information and run self-tests.

title: Software RAID with `mdadm`
note: Teach how to create, manage, and monitor software RAID arrays (RAID 0, 1, 5, 6) using the `mdadm` utility.

title: Logical Volume Management (LVM)
note: Deep dive into LVM. Cover creating and extending Physical Volumes, Volume Groups, and Logical Volumes. Introduce snapshots and thin provisioning.

title: iSCSI
note: Explain how to configure a Linux system as an iSCSI target (server) and initiator (client) to provide and consume block storage over the network.

title: Module 5: Networking - Advanced Configuration
note: Go beyond basic IP configuration. Teach how to configure network bonds (link aggregation) and bridges for virtual networking.

title: Routing
note: Explain static vs. dynamic routing. Show how to manually add and delete static routes using the `ip route` command.

title: Network Troubleshooting with `tcpdump`
note: Introduce `tcpdump` for capturing and analyzing network packets. Cover basic filtering to isolate specific traffic.

title: Module 6: DNS - BIND Server
note: Teach how to install and configure a BIND9 DNS server. Explain the `named.conf` file structure and how to define zones.

title: DNS Zone Files
note: Detail the syntax of DNS zone files. Cover essential record types: SOA, NS, A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, and PTR.

title: Securing DNS
note: Discuss DNS security concepts. Show how to restrict zone transfers and configure BIND to run in a chroot jail.

title: Module 7: Web Services - Apache HTTP Server
note: Teach how to install and configure the Apache HTTP Server. Cover the main configuration file, virtual hosts, and loading modules.

title: Apache: HTTPS with SSL/TLS
note: Guide through creating a self-signed SSL certificate and configuring an Apache virtual host to serve HTTPS traffic.

title: Nginx as a Web Server
note: Introduce Nginx. Show how to configure it as a high-performance static web server.

title: Nginx as a Reverse Proxy
note: Teach how to configure Nginx as a reverse proxy to balance load or provide a secure frontend for backend application servers.

title: Squid Proxy Server
note: Explain how to set up Squid as a caching forward proxy to speed up web access and filter content using Access Control Lists (ACLs).

title: Module 8: File Sharing - Samba Server
note: Teach how to configure a Samba server for file sharing with Windows clients. Cover the `smb.conf` file, defining shares, and setting up user access.

title: NFS Server
note: Teach how to configure an NFS server to share directories with other Linux/Unix clients. Cover the `/etc/exports` file and mount options.

title: Module 9: Network Client Management - DHCP Server
note: Guide through installing and configuring an ISC DHCP server. Cover defining subnets, ranges, and static reservations.

title: PAM Authentication
note: Explain the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) framework. Show how the files in `/etc/pam.d/` control authentication for different services.

title: LDAP Client Configuration
note: Teach how to configure a Linux client to authenticate against a central LDAP directory using tools like `sssd`.

title: Module 10: Email Services - Postfix MTA
note: Teach how to configure the Postfix mail server for sending and receiving email. Cover the main configuration files and setting up basic relays.

title: Dovecot IMAP/POP3 Server
note: Show how to install and configure Dovecot to allow mail clients to access mailboxes using IMAP or POP3.

title: Module 11: System Security - Router Configuration
note: Teach how to configure a Linux system to act as a network router using IP forwarding and NAT with `iptables`.

title: Firewalls with `iptables`
note: Introduce `iptables`. Explain chains (INPUT, OUTPUT, FORWARD), tables (filter, nat), and targets (ACCEPT, DROP, REJECT). Show how to build a basic firewall ruleset.

title: OpenSSH Server Security
note: Teach how to harden the SSH server by modifying `sshd_config` to disable root login, disable password authentication, and use key-based authentication only.

title: Intrusion Detection with `fail2ban`
note: Introduce `fail2ban` as a tool to mitigate brute-force attacks. Show how to configure a jail to monitor SSH logs and block malicious IPs.

title: Module 12: Final Project - Mixed-Network Office Server
note: Outline the final project: configure a single Linux server to provide DNS, DHCP, file sharing (Samba & NFS), and a secure web server for a small office environment.

title: Final Project: Planning and Setup
note: Plan the IP address scheme, hostnames, and user accounts. Configure the server with a static IP.

title: Final Project: Core Services (DHCP, DNS)
note: Configure the DHCP server to manage the client network and the BIND server to provide name resolution.

title: Final Project: File and Web Services
note: Configure Samba and NFS shares for different departments. Configure Apache or Nginx with a self-signed SSL certificate.

title: Final Project: Security Hardening
note: Implement an `iptables` firewall, harden SSH, and configure `fail2ban` for the project server.

title: Module 13: Further Reading
note: Provide links to official documentation for key services (BIND, Apache, Samba), the LPI's website, and resources for preparing for other advanced certifications like RHCE.
